content: Stores specializing in the supply of religious material A **religious goods store**, also known as a **religious bookstore**, **religious gifts store** or **religious supplies shop**, is a store specializing in supplying materials used in the practice of a particular religious tradition, such as [Buddhism](/wiki/Buddhism), [Taoism](/wiki/Taoism), [Chinese folk religion](/wiki/Chinese_folk_religion), [Christianity](/wiki/Christianity) and [Islam](/wiki/Islam) among other religions. These shops are abundant across the Greater Chinese region as well as Overseas Chinese communities around the world. In Iran, religious goods stores are usually visited to buy the [Quran](/wiki/Quran), Al Mafatih-Al Jinan, goods like the [tasbīḥ](/wiki/Misbaha), and many other things. One of the services related to this is to add a page to [Mafatih al-Jinan](/wiki/Mafatih_al-Jinan) book for a deceased loved one. In [Christendom](/wiki/Christendom), religious goods stores are often visited to purchase Christian art, books and devotional material for the home, as well as gifts such as [Bibles](/wiki/Bible), [Ichthys](/wiki/Ichthys) emblems, [daily devotionals](/wiki/Daily_devotional) or [cross necklaces](/wiki/Cross_necklace) for occasions such as [baptism](/wiki/Baptism), [confirmation](/wiki/Confirmation) and [marriage](/wiki/Christian_views_on_marriage). ## Items for sale ### Buddhism In Buddhist bookshops, a variety of [Buddhist books](/wiki/Buddhist_texts) and [chanting CDs](/wiki/Buddhist_chant) are usually available for sales. There is also wide range of other products which includes [Buddha statues](/wiki/Buddha_in_art), Buddhist pendants, incense, candles, [chanting beads](/wiki/Japamala), instruments, Buddhist monastics' robes, meditation cushions and other Buddhist accessories. ### Christianity In [Christendom](/wiki/Christendom), "religious goods stores", also known as "Christian bookstores", have [family Bibles](/wiki/Family_Bible_(book)), [Christian art](/wiki/Christian_art), [daily devotional books](/wiki/Daily_devotional), [breviaries](/wiki/Breviary), [catechisms](/wiki/Catechism), [cross necklaces](/wiki/Cross_necklace), [Christian music albums](/wiki/Christian_music), [holy cards](/wiki/Holy_card), [home altars](/wiki/Home_altar), [prie-dieus](/wiki/Prie-dieu), and prayer beads (such as the [Dominican Rosary](/wiki/Dominican_Rosary) of [Catholicism](/wiki/Catholicism), the [Wreath of Christ](/wiki/Wreath_of_Christ) of [Lutheranism](/wiki/Lutheranism), the [Anglican rosary](/wiki/Anglican_Rosary) of [Anglicanism](/wiki/Anglicanism), and the [prayer rope](/wiki/Prayer_rope) of [Eastern Orthodoxy](/wiki/Eastern_Orthodoxy)), among other [sacramentals](/wiki/Sacramental) such as [Ichthys](/wiki/Ichthys) (Jesus fish) emblems for vehicles. ### Chinese folk religion and Taoism - Statues representing [Chinese deities](/wiki/Shen_(Chinese_religion)), also include [bodhisattva](/wiki/Bodhisattva) images like [Guanyin](/wiki/Guanyin) or [Di Zang Wang](/wiki/Ksitigarbha) - [Tong Sheng](/wiki/Tung_Shing) (通勝), Chinese divination guide and almanac - [all form of Chinese incenses](/wiki/Incense_in_China), [kemenyan](/wiki/Kemenyan) and candles - [incense papers](/wiki/Joss_paper), [underworld bank notes](/wiki/Hell_bank_note) and various forms of [paper offerings](/wiki/Zhizha) - tablets dedicated to [Tian Gong](/wiki/Jade_Emperor) (天公), [Tu Di Gong](/wiki/Tudigong) (土地公), [Zao Jun](/wiki/Kitchen_God) (灶君) and [ancestral tablets](/wiki/Ancestral_tablet) - unconsecrated religious devotional objects like [Pa-Kua](/wiki/Pa-kua), Qian Kun Tai Ji Tu and Shang Hai Zheng - incense urns or incense holders - [Chinese teapots](/wiki/Teapot), tea cups and Chinese tea leaves - incense paper burners - [incense sticks](/wiki/Incense) ## Gallery - [Chinese folk religion](/wiki/Chinese_folk_religion) - [Chinese folk religion in Southeast Asia](/wiki/Chinese_folk_religion_in_Southeast_Asia) - [Chinese ancestral worship](/wiki/Ancestor_veneration_in_China) - [Ancestral hall](/wiki/Ancestral_hall) & [Ancestral tablets](/wiki/Spirit_tablet) -
